Hey Colin,

Wow it sounds like SharpNEAT is getting pretty fancy.  I imagine it
will be useful to a lot of people.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Colin Green <cgreen@d...> wrote:
> Things are progressing nicely on the SharpNeat front. This week
there 
> are a few nice performance improvements and additional
configurability 
> in the GUI. I have also made the decision to start releasing under
the 
> GPL/LGPL. See www.cgreen.dsl.pipex.com for details.
> 
> Stuff in the pipeline:
> 
>  - Realtime network visualization in the simulation projects using
a 
> color range to indicate neuron activation and signal strength in 
> connections. If all goes to plan then this same network drawing
code 
> should also appear in the main exe, showing the structure of the
best 
> network. Hopefully ready in about 1 week.
> 
>  - Distributed NEAT. I have been casting an eye over the 
> network/remoting support in .Net. I think two distinct approaches
are 
> required. 1) Client/Server where folks can connect in to a server
and 
> choose to dedicate CPU timer to a specific problem, kind of how 
> distributed.net works (worked?).  2) master/slave - slave machines 
> directly controled by a master, this more like the beowulk
arrangemet 
> typically used in research set ups.
> 
> Along with this weeks performance improvements, a scalable
distributed 
> approach should provide a nice boost for researching more CPU
intensive 
> problems. Well that's the plan.
> 
> Colin.
